body: What type of supernova occurs when there is runaway fusion in a secondary white dwarf after enough mass transfer from a giant star?
Which of the following air masses is most likely to be present above western Washington in February?
How many games need to be played in a single-elimination tournament to declare a winner from 16 teams?
Two concentric circles have radii of 5 and 12. What is the area of the region in between the circles?

A car starts accelerating from the top of a 9-meter tall ramp from rest. The ramp makes an angle of 30 degrees with the horizontal. Given that the car accelerates at 1 meter per second squared, how long does it take, in seconds, for the ball to go down the ramp?
A 40-kilogram box is sitting at rest on a 30 degree incline. In newtons, what is the magnitude of the frictional force acting on the block?
Which of the following is the electron configuration of the $\athrm{Mg}^{2 + }$ ion?
Identify all of the following three quantities that are state functions: 1) Volume; 2) Heat; 3) Work.
Identify all of the following four cell junctions that can be found between animal cells: 1) Tight junctions; 2) Desmosomes; 3) Gap junctions; 4) Plasmodesmata.
Which of the following is NOT an organ that may be used by an amphibian to perform gas exchange?

Scientists at SLAC National Accelerator Lab are researching efficient methods for synthesizing diamonds via the compression of diamondoids, a class of materials extracted from crude oil. Under high pressure, what element is released from diamondoids, leaving the residual carbon?

Scientists at Fermilab, Brookhaven National Lab, and Lawrence Berkeley National Lab have designed a niobium-tin quadrupole magnet that sets the record for the highest field strength ever recorded for an accelerator focusing magnet. The niobium-tin alloy is a superconductor that expels magnetic fields via what effect?
What law of thermodynamics states that the internal energy change of an isolated system is zero?

A vessel containing 3 moles of $\athrm{H}_{2}$ gas is held at pressure of 2 atmospheres and a volume of 9 liters. If another 3 moles of gas are added, and the container is expanded to a volume of 12 liters, what is the final pressure of the vessel, in atmospheres, assuming constant temperature?
Which of the following is NOT characteristic of eudicots?

choices.W: Vascular bundles arranged in a circle

body: The nuclear lamina is a dense network important for maintaining the structural integrity of the nucleus. What type of cytoskeletal element composes the majority of the nuclear lamina?
What is the name of the primary mechanism of helium-4 fusion in medium-mass stars?
An air parcel in the Northern Hemisphere subsides and creates a high pressure system at the surface. Which of the following best describes airflow in the system?
The point (4, 2) is reflected across the $y$ -axis and then translated 8 units up. What are the final coordinates of the point?

Connorâ€™s drawer contains 3 green socks, 6 red socks, 9 blue socks, and 2 yellow socks. What is the minimum number of socks Connor needs to pull from his drawer to guarantee that he has at least 1 pair of each color?
A circuit contains a 12-volt battery connected in series with a 3-ohm resistor. What is the power dissipated by the resistor in watts?

A 50-kilogram sphere collides head-on in a perfectly elastic collision with a metal plate of mass $m$. As the value of $m$ approaches infinity, which of the following best describes the behavior of the system after the collision?

choices.W: The sphere will stick to the plate and both objects will move at the sphere's original velocity
choices.X: The sphere will stop moving and the plate will move at the sphere's original velocity
choices.Y: The sphere will stick to the plate and stop moving
choices.Z: The sphere will begin traveling in the opposite direction with the same speed

answer: Z) THE SPHERE WILL BEGIN TRAVELING IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION WITH THE SAME SPEED

body: DOE Researchers at Ames Lab have discovered that periodic vibrational motion may stabilize some currently unstable electron states, which can make advanced quantum computing possible. On a macroscopic level, what is the name for this periodic vibrational motion?
Researchers at CERN are running the Baryon Antibaryon Symmetry Experiment, or BASE, to look for differences between matter and antimatter. Which of the following particles is a baryon?
A Carnot engine has a hot reservoir of 102 degrees Celsius and an efficiency of $40\$. In degrees Celsius, what is the temperature of the cold reservoir?
A projectile is launched from the ground at a 45 degree angle. If it reaches a maximum height of 23 meters, what is its horizontal range in meters?
What is the largest structure in the nucleus of eukaryotic cells?
What enzyme participates in both the citric acid cycle and the electron transport chain?
What is the area of an isosceles right triangle with a hypotenuse of 6 times the square root of 2?
What is the greatest common factor of 350 and 518?
What is the general term for a substance that accelerates a chemical reaction by providing an alternate pathway for the reaction to occur?
Rank the following three ions in terms of increasing ionic radius: 1) $\athrm{Na}^{+}$; 2) $\athrm{Al}^{3+}$; 3) $\athrm{F}^{-}$.
Which of the following statements concerning plate tectonics is NOT true?

choices.W: Slab pull contributes much more driving force than ridge push
choices.X: In a collision between two oceanic plates, the older one sinks
choices.Y: Mid-ocean ridges are associated with asthenosphere upwelling
choices.Z: Continental plates are generally denser than oceanic plates

answer: Z) CONTINENTAL PLATES ARE GENERALLY DENSER THAN OCEANIC PLATES

body: What oceanic layer is characterized by a rapid vertical change in density?
The frequency of a photon is directly related to its energy by what physical constant?

An ideal Atwood machine has two blocks of masses 3 and 4 kilograms connected by a string on either side of a pulley. In meters per second squared, which of the following is the acceleration of the system?
Several types of non-Watson-Crick base pairing may occur during translation due to what phenomenon involving genetic code redundancy?
Tracheids and vessel elements are components of what vascular tissue in plants?

Scientists at Pacific Northwest National Lab are working on improving the stability of qubits in quantum computers. Qubits can be represented as a linear combination of two states that are joined by what quantum mechanical principle?
Scientists at Sandia National Lab have developed a prototype for a cheaper device to perform magnetoencephalography. Which of the following best describes the function of magnetoencephalography?

choices.W: It probes the brain with a magnetic field and measures the rebound
choices.X: It probes the heart with a magnetic field and measures the rebound
choices.Y: It detects magnetic fields from the electrical signals in the brain
choices.Z: It detects magnetic fields from the electrical signals in the heart

answer: Y) IT DETECTS MAGNETIC FIELDS FROM THE ELECTRICAL SIGNALS IN THE BRAIN

body: Which of the following polynomials has more than 4 roots?
A sequence has $a_1 = 2$, $a_2 = 4$, and $a_{n + 2} = 3a_{n + 1} - a_n$ for all positive integers $n$. What is $a_5$?
Which of the following unit cells has the lowest coordination number?
The variation of vapor pressure with temperature can be calculated using what equation?
Which of the following fluvial environments would most likely involve braided stream morphology?

choices.W: Outwash plain of an alpine glacier

answer: W) OUTWASH PLAIN OF AN ALPINE GLACIER

body: Which of the following rocks would most likely function as an aquitard?
